text: Edward Morley (January 29, 1838 – February 24, 1923) was an American physicist. He is known for the Michelson–Morley experiment. He found a more accurate number for the speed of light. He also found how heavy an atom of oxygen is. == References == Category:1838 births Category:1923 deaths Category:American physicists Category:People from West Hartford, Connecticut
title: Edward Morley
